original: @223a * // bkra shis kyi tshigs su bcad pa bzhugs//
analyzed: @223a * // bkra shis kyi tshigs su bcad pa bzhugs//
translated: The Verses of Auspiciousness

original: # // dpal rnal 'byor gyi rgyud kyi dkyil 'khor gyi lha de bzhin gshegs pa rigs lnga 'khor dang bcas pa lha sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bkra shis tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: # // dpal rnal 'byor gyi rgyud kyi dkyil 'khor gyi lha de bzhin gshegs pa rigs lnga 'khor dang bcas pa lha sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bkra shis tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: The Verses of Auspiciousness of the Thirty-Seven Deities of the Glorious Yoga Tantra Mandala, the Five Tathāgata Families and Their Retinue

original: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal lo ;
analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal lo ;
translated: Homage to glorious Vajrasattva.

original: / bcom ldan rnam par snang mdzad rgyal ba mi bskyod pa //
analyzed: / bcom ldan rnam par snang mdzad rgyal ba mi bskyod pa //
translated: The Blessed One Vairocana, the Victor Akṣobhya,

original: rin chen 'byung ldan 'dod pa med dang don yod grub //
analyzed: rin chen 'byung ldan 'dod pa med dang don yod grub //
translated: Ratnasaṃbhava, free from desire, and Amoghasiddhi—

original: rigs lnga bde gshegs rnams kyi bkra shis gang yod pa //
analyzed: rigs lnga bde gshegs rnams kyi bkra shis gang yod pa //
translated: Whatever auspiciousness there is of the five families of sugatas,🔽by that supreme auspiciousness, may there be auspiciousness here today.

original: bkra shis dam pa des kyang deng 'dir bkra shis shog / rdo rje sems ma dang ni rin chen sems ma dang // chos kyi sems ma dang ni las kyi sems mar bcas //
analyzed: bkra shis dam pa des kyang deng 'dir bkra shis shog / rdo rje sems ma dang ni rin chen sems ma dang // chos kyi sems ma dang ni las kyi sems mar bcas //
translated: Vajra- sattva, Ratna-sattva, Dharma-sattva, and Karma-sattva,

original: bcom ldan yum mchog rnams kyi bkra shis gang yod pa //
analyzed: bcom ldan yum mchog rnams kyi bkra shis gang yod pa //
translated: together with the supreme consorts of the Blessed Ones—

original: bkra shis dam pa des kyang deng 'dir bkra shis shog / rdo rje sems dpa' dang ni rdo rje rgyal po dang // rdo rje chags pa dang ni rdo rje legs par bcas //
analyzed: bkra shis dam pa des kyang deng 'dir bkra shis shog / rdo rje sems dpa' dang ni rdo rje rgyal po dang // rdo rje chags pa dang ni rdo rje legs par bcas //
translated: Vajrarāga, and Vajrasādhu,

original: bcom ldan mi bskyod 'khor gyi bkra shis gang yod pa //
analyzed: bcom ldan mi bskyod 'khor gyi bkra shis gang yod pa //
translated: whatever auspiciousness there is in the retinue of the Bhagavān Akṣobhya,🔽may that most sublime auspiciousness bring auspiciousness here today!🔽Great Vajra, Vajratejas,

original: bkra shis dam pa des kyang deng 'dir bkra shis shog / rdo rje chen dang ni rdo rje gzi brjid dang // rdo rje rgyal mtshan dang ni rdo rje bzhad par bcas //
analyzed: bkra shis dam pa des kyang deng 'dir bkra shis shog / rdo rje chen dang ni rdo rje gzi brjid dang // rdo rje rgyal mtshan dang ni rdo rje bzhad par bcas //
translated: Vajradhvaja, and Vajrahasita,

original: bcom ldan rin 'byung 'khor @223b gyi bkra shis gang yod pa //
analyzed: bcom ldan rin 'byung 'khor @223b gyi bkra shis gang yod pa //
translated: whatever auspiciousness there is in the retinue of the Bhagavān Ratnasaṃbhava,🔽may that most sublime auspiciousness bring auspiciousness here today!🔽Vajradharma, Vajratīkṣṇa,

original: bkra shis dam pa des kyang deng 'dir bkra shis shog / rdo rje chos rab dang ni rdo rje rnon po dang // rdo rje 'khor lo dang ni rdo rje sma bar bcas //
analyzed: bkra shis dam pa des kyang deng 'dir bkra shis shog / rdo rje chos rab dang ni rdo rje rnon po dang // rdo rje 'khor lo dang ni rdo rje sma bar bcas //
translated: Vajracakra, and Vajrahetu,

original: bcom ldan snang mtha'i 'khor gyi bkra shis gang yod pa //
analyzed: bcom ldan snang mtha'i 'khor gyi bkra shis gang yod pa //
translated: whatever auspiciousness there is in the retinue of the Bhagavān Amitābha,🔽may that most sublime auspiciousness bring auspiciousness here today!

original: bkra shis dam pa des kyang deng 'dir bkra shis shog / rdo rje las rab dang ni rdo rje srung ba dang // rdo rje gnod sbyin dang ni rdo rje khu tshur bcas //
analyzed: bkra shis dam pa des kyang deng 'dir bkra shis shog / rdo rje las rab dang ni rdo rje srung ba dang // rdo rje gnod sbyin dang ni rdo rje khu tshur bcas //
translated: Vajrakarma, Vajravarma, Vajrayakṣa, and Vajramuṣṭi,

original: bcom ldan don grub 'khor gyi bkra shis gong yod pa //
analyzed: bcom ldan don grub 'khor gyi bkra shis gong yod pa //
translated: the auspiciousness of the retinue of the Bhagavat Siddhārtha,🔽may this most auspicious thing bring auspiciousness here today!

original: bkra shis dam pa des kyang deng 'dir bkra shis shog / lha mo sgeg mo dang ni lha mo phreng ba ma //
analyzed: bkra shis dam pa des kyang deng 'dir bkra shis shog / lha mo sgeg mo dang ni lha mo phreng ba ma //
translated: Goddess Lāsya, Goddess Mālā,

original: lha mo glu ma dang ni lha mo gar mar bcas //
analyzed: lha mo glu ma dang ni lha mo gar mar bcas //
translated: Goddess Gītā, and Goddess Nṛtya,

original: nang gi mchod pa'i lha mo'i bkra shis gang yod pa //
analyzed: nang gi mchod pa'i lha mo'i bkra shis gang yod pa //
translated: the auspiciousness of the goddesses of inner offerings,🔽may this most auspicious thing bring auspiciousness here today!

original: bkra shis dam pa des kyang ding 'dir bkra shis shog / lha mo bdug spos ma dang lha mo me tog ma //
analyzed: bkra shis dam pa des kyang ding 'dir bkra shis shog / lha mo bdug spos ma dang lha mo me tog ma //
translated: Goddess Dhūpā, Goddess Puṣpā,

original: lha mo mar me ma dang lha mo dri mar bcas //
analyzed: lha mo mar me ma dang lha mo dri mar bcas //
translated: Goddess Dīpā, and Goddess Gandhā,

original: phyi yi mchod pa'i lha mo'i bkra shis gang yod pa //
analyzed: phyi yi mchod pa'i lha mo'i bkra shis gang yod pa //
translated: the auspiciousness of the goddesses of outer offerings,🔽may this most auspicious thing bring auspiciousness here today!

original: bkra shis dam pa des kyang ding 'dir bkra shis shog / sgo ba lcags kyu dang ni sgo ba zhags pa dang // sgo ba lcags sgrog dang ni sgo ba dril bur bcas //
analyzed: bkra shis dam pa des kyang ding 'dir bkra shis shog / sgo ba lcags kyu dang ni sgo ba zhags pa dang // sgo ba lcags sgrog dang ni sgo ba dril bur bcas //
translated: the door-guardians with chains, and the door-guardians with bells,

original: bcom ldan sgo srung rnams kyi bkra shis gang yod pa //
analyzed: bcom ldan sgo srung rnams kyi bkra shis gang yod pa //
translated: whatever auspiciousness exists for the blessed door-guardians,🔽may there be auspiciousness here today through that most sublime auspiciousness!

original: bkra shis dam pa des kyang deng 'dir bkra shis shog / dpal rnal 'byor gyi rgyud kyi dkyil 'khor gyi lha de bzhin gshegs pa rigs lnga 'khor dang bcas pa lha sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bkra shis tshigs su bcad pa rdzogs so//
analyzed: bkra shis dam pa des kyang deng 'dir bkra shis shog / dpal rnal 'byor gyi rgyud kyi dkyil 'khor gyi lha de bzhin gshegs pa rigs lnga 'khor dang bcas pa lha sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bkra shis tshigs su bcad pa rdzogs so//
translated: The verses of auspiciousness of the thirty-seven deities of the glorious yoga tantra mandala of the five buddha families of the tathāgatas are complete.
